answers.answer: If your sites are bending, it is not the pump that is the issue, it is you.  I have the same pump and have never had any issues with it.  You are obviously not taking better control of your diabetes, and testing often enough, because it takes more than missing insulin for a moment to hit DKA.  I suggest you start by checking more often, and if the pump is still under warranty, medtronic will send you a new one, to stop the issue with no delivery.  I have had them for almost 10 years and have never had an issue with them not working me whenever there has been an issue.
see if u can't just get new equipment ordered by dr.or go off the pump and take care of it thru the dayor look around and see if u can find a mfg offering free equip if u switch overgood luck

question: I've had diabetes since I was 10. I am now 20. This past year I think I've had the most problems with my pump. I use the paradigm. I've been getting motor errors as well as NO Delivery. But in the past week I have had DKA probably 4 times, but not bad enough to go to the hospital . My sites have been bending so that I don't receive the insulin. I use the 6mm. I am not one to talk about my diabetes but lately I can not handle it anyone else having these problems or had them in the past? Or know a better pump? I've called Medtronic  but they were  no help.
title: problems with paradigm
